sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King. A proclamation for the inhibiting all manner of oathes, other abuses and prophanations by any of His Majesties army; as likewise strictly commanding the due and constant frequenting of the service of God, by all the officers and souldiers of the same. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I) Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
by Leonard Lichfield, printer to the University, Printed at Oxford : 1643.
Dated at end: Given at our court at Oxford, the thirteenth day of Iune, in the nineteenth yeare of Our raigne. Arms 37; Steele notation: Govern- upon them. . Steele states 'not found'. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
